originalText.text:
Spot-on K9 Training came highly recommended by a close friend, so we knew we could trust that Stephen would be able to help us!

We reached out to Stephen when our puppy Milly was about 8 months old. She started to become reactive to other dogs on the leash, she was barking a lot in the home, she was having a very hard time relaxing, and she was pulling a ton on walks. We had tried working with 2 other trainers before, but the problems we were having were not getting any better.

After just the first session with Stephen, the improvement we saw with her pulling and reactivity was incredible. We could not believe that after just one hour long session we could see such amazing results.

Stephen helped us realize that due to our dogs breed and temperament, she needed more structure and discipline than we were giving her before. He gave us the tools that we needed to help our puppy become more obedient and confident.

We still have a lot of work to do at home, reinforcing the rules that Stephen helped us set for our pup. But we are so grateful to him and all of the help he gave us! We would definitely recommend Spot-On K9 training to anyone who asks!

originalText.text:
Trey is our third Brittany and to be honest it was a difficult time for my husband and I to go from being pet parents of an 11-year-old ‘velcro’ dog to a curious, full of energy pup.  We really wanted to be able to let him explore Central Park during off leash hours as well as hike with him outside of the city, but his recall was inconsistent. We truly were at a loss on how to exercise him… and keep his spirit and our sanity.
Stephen was recommended to us by two sets of ‘dog’ friends who had trained with him – and we can’t thank them and Stephen enough. We initially went for e-collar training but got leash training and pointers on all sorts of aspects along the way. Stephen’s patience with us over the course of the summer proved invaluable. He let us learn at our own pace - which was weekly at the beginning and slowed once we went into the e-collar part as I was not comfortable with the technology and the coordination it took to operate. But fast forward to our ‘graduation’ class - we performed beautifully and comfortably (which I think is the key to e-collar training). These days we head to Central Park every morning to enjoy the off-leash hours. It is pure joy to watch Trey run free. We could not have done this without Stephen’s expertise (and patience) and can't recommend him enough!

originalText.text:
We adopted our 2.5 year old mixed boy, Sal, in October 2023 and quickly learned he was an absolute nightmare when it came to walks. We didn't know anything about Sal's history, but he was not fond of other dogs to say the least. He would growl and lunge at every single dog that walked by on top of just having poor leash manners in general (constant pulling, zig zagging, and sniffing the ground). After a few weeks, we realized we couldn't do this anymore  - walks were so stressful for us, and we weren't giving Sal enough exercise.

After ONE training session with Stephen, Sal was basically a new dog. While Sal still had a lot of work to do - we were able to walk more than a couple of blocks stress-free. After our next few sessions, we've really learned how to manage Sal's reactivity and advocate for our dog. Two things Stephen did for us was show us the correct training equipment to use AND how to be a confident owner with a reactive dog.

Sal has gotten SO much better in just 5 sessions - we're able to take him on our long walk to our favorite coffee shop in the mornings without worrying about how he'll behave while passing dogs. He's making better decisions every single day and now it's FUN to walk our dog around the city.

I'm so happy we realized pretty early on that we needed a trainer to help us. Stephen is more than knowledgeable, you can tell he's REALLY passionate about helping dogs be their best selves. Plus, Sal absolutely LOVED being around Stephen! We are so thankful for Stephen and all he's done to help us - I would absolutely recommend Spot-On K9 training to anyone looking to give their pup a better, happier, and more structured life!

originalText.text:
Stephen was so helpful with Bao and when we came to him we were not in a great situation. Bao had started chasing and biting/attacking people's feet. Sometimes he would attack someone's foot seemingly out of nowhere. I had lost trust in him after seeing this aggression and now after working with Stephen I have built back the trust between myself and my dog in addition to having more confidence as a dog owner and understanding my dog's behaviors.

I learned how to pick up on Bao's agitation cues and control his response to triggers by intervening before his aggression resulted in an attack. A great perspective I learned from Stephen is #1 teaching your dog how to make better choices and #2 creating a safe environment suitable for your dog if they have triggers. I can proudly say that with our new techniques with all of the commands Bao learned and e collar training that Stephen provided, Bao is making better decisions every day! My dog responded really well to the boundaries we set in training. We can walk in the park off leash and I know I have an effective recall with the e collar in case any altercations with other dogs occur. I simply call him back to me and we keep enjoying our walk before anything escalates. Thanks to Stephen, the respect and understanding between myself and my dog has deepened and our lives have been changed forever! Thank you Stephen!!

originalText.text: Had a great experience working with and learning from Stephen. I have a high energy and over stimulated bird dog, and I had never imagined I would have the confidence to let her off-leash, let alone in Central Park with so many birds and squirrels around. Stephen patiently walked us through each of the steps building up to the final classes when she was able to enjoy off-leash time!
